DataElement.preferredName: SF-36v2 Health Survey Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Have a Lot of Energy Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated perception of how much of the time during the past four weeks they have had a lot of energy, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard US Version 2.0 Questionnaire Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Have a Lot of Energy Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred._A question about whether an individual has or had a lot of energy._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.longName: Short Form 36 Health Survey Standard, US Version 2.0 Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized, multipurpose, general health survey developed by John E. Ware and copyrighted by Quality Metric Inc. and the Medical Outcomes Trust in 1996 and 2000 which is used to assess the patient's functional health and overall well-being. This second version contains 36 questions that refer to the patient's symptoms or status within the past four weeks and can be completed by the patient. For each question the patient must choose from five different responses.

Property.preferredName: Past 4 Weeks How Much of the Time Have a Lot of Energy Score

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.
A question about how much of the time something is occurring or has occurred.
A question about whether an individual has or had a lot of energy.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
